com.jbion.utils.xml.serialization.serializers

Class SimpleSerializer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jbion.utils.xml.serialization.serializers.Serializer<T>
      • com.jbion.utils.xml.serialization.serializers.SimpleSerializer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type managed by this serializer.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DateSerializer, DurationSerializer, EnumSerializer

    public abstract class SimpleSerializer<T>
extends Serializer<T>
    An XML serializer for any class simple enough to be serialized as a String .

    The method deserialize(String) has to be implemented in subclasses. However, it is not necessary to override serialize(Object). Indeed, a default version using the method Object.toString() is already implemented, and is sufficient in most cases.

    Author:
    Joffrey Bion
    See Also:
    Serializer

      • serialize

        public String serialize(Object object)
                 throws ClassCastException
        Converts the specified object into a String.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to serialize.
        Returns:
        The serialized String.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - If the class of the specified object is not consistent with the class handled by this serializer.

      • deserialize

        public abstract T deserialize(String s)
                       throws ParseException
        Retrieves an object from the specified String.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to convert, which is guaranteed not to be null, though it may be equal to "null".
        Returns:
        The created object.
        Throws:
        ParseException - If the String cannot be parsed as an object of the class handled by this serializer.
